comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Austin Willard Lord (1860-1922) was an architect, headed the School of Architecture at Columbia University: eng.archinform.net/arch/7461.htm

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: books.google.com/books?id=-t4DAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA330&l... indictaes that the wife of Austin Willard Lord was the former Margaret Elizabeth Gage

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Another Bain/LOC photo of Mrs. Austin Lord: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4866202530/in/photostream/] She appears to have been a participant in the Beaux Arts Society's Venetian Pageant at the Hotel Astor. New York Times story, February 21, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9D03E0DF163AE6...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Other Bain/LOC photos have the same props and backdrop:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4865583995/in/photostream/]

(It's likely that Gertrude Lord was daughter to Mrs. Austin Lord)
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4865584485/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Other Bain/LOC photos of the New York Beaux Arts Society's Venetian Pageant at the Hotel Astor, February 20, 1914:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4865583559/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Thank you to all for research into this interesting event! We will add more details when we update the descriptive information.
